items.quote: Setting up my tech consultancy in Dubai Internet City was smoother than I imagined. One Nexuz handled everything — from license approvals to securing the perfect flexi-desk. I was operational in just 12 days and already networking with industry leaders.

I wanted a business location that gave credibility and global exposure. With One Nexuz guiding me through DIC’s process, I not only got my license quickly but also connected with potential clients within the first month.

The biggest worry for me was compliance and paperwork. One Nexuz made sure every document was in order and kept me updated at every step. Now my startup is based in one of the most prestigious hubs in the region.

faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: How long does it take to set up a business in Dubai Internet City?
items.answer: It generally takes 1-3 weeks to launch your business in DIC. However, our experts fast-track the process, empowering you to get started in 1-14 days.

items.question: Do I need a local sponsor to launch a DIC company?
items.answer: No, Dubai Internet City allows 100% foreign ownership with no local sponsor or partner required.

items.question: Do I need to own or rent a physical office to set up in Dubai Internet City?
items.answer: You can explore alternative office solutions, such as a flexi-desk, virtual, or co-working spaces in DIC to simplify business setup.

items.question: What documents do I need for DIC company formation?
items.answer: Typically, you'll need passport copies, proof of address, business plan, and in some cases, qualifications or portfolio, depending on your selected license.

items.question: Can I operate outside the Free Zone with a DIC license?
items.answer: You can work with the UAE mainland clients through a local distributor, service agent, or by opening a mainland branch.
